Stench.description: By releasing stench when attacking, this Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.

Drizzle.description: The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.

Speed Boost.description: Its Speed stat is boosted every turn.

Battle Armor.description: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

Sturdy.description: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

Damp.description: Prevents the use of explosive moves such as Self-Destruct by dampening its surroundings.

Limber.description: Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.

Sand Veil.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s evasion in a sandstorm.

Static.description: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis.

Volt Absorb.description: Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move, instead of taking damage.

Water Absorb.description: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move, instead of taking damage.

Oblivious.description: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

Compound Eyes.description: The Pokémon’s compound eyes boost its accuracy.

Insomnia.description: The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot fall asleep.

Color Change.description: The Pokémon’s type becomes the type of the move used on it.

Immunity.description: The immune system of the Pokémon prevents it from getting poisoned.

Flash Fire.description: Powers up the Pokémon’s Fire-type moves if it’s hit by one.

Shield Dust.description: This Pokémon’s dust blocks the additional effects of attacks taken.

Own Tempo.description: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.

Suction Cups.description: This Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot to negate all moves and items that force switching out.

Intimidate.description: The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon entering battle, lowering their Attack stat.

Shadow Tag.description: This Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon’s shadow to prevent it from escaping.

Rough Skin.description: This Pokémon inflicts damage with its rough skin to the attacker on contact.

Wonder Guard.description: Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves hit the Pokémon.

Levitate.description: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

Effect Spore.description: Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep, or paralysis on its attacker.

Synchronize.description: The attacker will receive the same status condition if it inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.

Clear Body.description: Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon’s stats.

Natural Cure.description: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.

Lightning Rod.description: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves. Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.

Serene Grace.description: Boosts the likelihood of additional effects occurring when attacking.

Swift Swim.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in rain.

Chlorophyll.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in sunshine.

Illuminate.description: Raises the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon by illuminating the surroundings.

Trace.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon’s Ability.

Poison Point.description: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.

Inner Focus.description: The Pokémon’s intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.

Magma Armor.description: The Pokémon is covered with hot magma, which prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen.

Water Veil.description: The Pokémon is covered with a water veil, which prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

Magnet Pull.description: Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from escaping using its magnetic force.

Soundproof.description: Soundproofing of the Pokémon itself gives full immunity to all sound-based moves.

Rain Dish.description: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.

Sand Stream.description: The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle.

Pressure.description: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.

Thick Fat.description: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat, which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

Early Bird.description: The Pokémon awakens twice as fast as other Pokémon from sleep.

Flame Body.description: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

Run Away.description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

Keen Eye.description: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon’s accuracy.

Hyper Cutter.description: The Pokémon’s proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.

Pickup.description: The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

Truant.description: The Pokémon can’t use a move the following turn if it uses one.

Hustle.description: Boosts the Attack stat, but lowers accuracy.

Cute Charm.description: Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.

Plus.description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

Minus.description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

Forecast.description: The Pokémon transforms with the weather to change its type to Water, Fire, or Ice.

Sticky Hold.description: Items held by the Pokémon are stuck fast and cannot be removed by other Pokémon.

Shed Skin.description: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

Guts.description: It’s so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat.

Marvel Scale.description: The Pokémon’s marvelous scales boost the Defense stat if it has a status condition.

Liquid Ooze.description: Oozed liquid has strong stench, which damages attackers using any draining move.

Overgrow.description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

Blaze.description: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

Torrent.description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

Swarm.description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

Rock Head.description: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

Drought.description: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Vital Spirit.description: The Pokémon is full of vitality, and that prevents it from falling asleep.

White Smoke.description: The Pokémon is protected by its white smoke, which prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

Pure Power.description: Using its pure power, the Pokémon doubles its Attack stat.

Shell Armor.description: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

Tangled Feet.description: Raises evasion if the Pokémon is confused.

Motor Drive.description: Boosts its Speed stat if hit by an Electric-type move, instead of taking damage.

Rivalry.description: Becomes competitive and deals more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but deals less to Pokémon of the opposite gender.

Steadfast.description: The Pokémon’s determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.

Gluttony.description: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.

Anger Point.description: The Pokémon is angered when it takes a critical hit, and that maxes its Attack stat.

Unburden.description: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon’s held item is used or lost.

Heatproof.description: The heatproof body of the Pokémon halves the damage from Fire-type moves that hit it.

Simple.description: The stat changes the Pokémon receives are doubled.

Dry Skin.description: Restores HP in rain or when hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in sunshine, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves.

Download.description: Compares an opposing Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def stats before raising its own Attack or Sp. Atk stat0whichever will be more effective.

Poison Heal.description: Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned, instead of losing HP.

Adaptability.description: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.

Skill Link.description: Maximizes the number of times multi-strike moves hit.

Hydration.description: Heals status conditions if it’s raining.

Solar Power.description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat in sunny weather, but HP decreases every turn.

Quick Feet.description: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon has a status condition.

Normalize.description: All the Pokémon’s moves become Normal type. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

Sniper.description: Powers up moves if they become critical hits when attacking.

Magic Guard.description: The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.

No Guard.description: The Pokémon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land.

Stall.description: The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.

Technician.description: Powers up the Pokémon’s weaker moves.

Leaf Guard.description: Prevents status conditions in sunny weather.

Klutz.description: The Pokémon can’t use any held items.

Mold Breaker.description: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

Super Luck.description: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.

Aftermath.description: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokémon with a finishing hit.

Anticipation.description: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon’s dangerous moves.

Forewarn.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can tell one of the moves an opposing Pokémon has.

Unaware.description: When attacking, the Pokémon ignores the target Pokémon’s stat changes.

Tinted Lens.description: The Pokémon can use “not very effective” moves to deal regular damage.

Filter.description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.

Slow Start.description: For five turns, the Pokémon’s Attack and Speed stats are halved.

Scrappy.description: The Pokémon can hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.

Storm Drain.description: Draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of being hit by Water-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.

Ice Body.description: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in a hailstorm.

Solid Rock.description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.

Snow Warning.description: The Pokémon summons a hailstorm when it enters a battle.

Honey Gather.description: The Pokémon may gather Honey after a battle.

Frisk.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s held item.

Reckless.description: Powers up moves that have recoil damage.

Multitype.description: Changes the Pokémon’s type to match the Plate or Z-Crystal it holds.

Flower Gift.description: Boosts the Attack and Sp. Def stats of itself and allies when it is sunny.

Bad Dreams.description: Reduces the HP of sleeping opposing Pokémon.

Pickpocket.description: Steals an item from an attacker that made direct contact.

Sheer Force.description: Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves when attacking.

Contrary.description: Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.

Unnerve.description: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.

Defiant.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat sharply when its stats are lowered.

Defeatist.description: Halves the Pokémon’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP becomes half or less.

Cursed Body.description: May disable a move used on the Pokémon.

Healer.description: Sometimes heals an ally’s status condition.

Weak Armor.description: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.

Multiscale.description: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes when its HP is full.

Toxic Boost.description: Powers up physical attacks when the Pokémon is poisoned.

Flare Boost.description: Powers up special attacks when the Pokémon is burned.

Harvest.description: May create another Berry after one is used.

Telepathy.description: Anticipates an ally’s attack and dodges it.

Moody.description: Raises one stat sharply and lowers another every turn.

Overcoat.description: Protects the Pokémon from things like sand, hail, and powder.

Poison Touch.description: May poison a target when the Pokémon makes contact.

Regenerator.description: Restores a little HP when withdrawn from battle.

Big Pecks.description: Protects the Pokémon from Defense-lowering effects.

Sand Rush.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in a sandstorm.

Wonder Skin.description: Makes status moves more likely to miss.

Analytic.description: Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.

Illusion.description: Comes out disguised as the Pokémon in the party’s last spot.

Imposter.description: The Pokémon transforms itself into the Pokémon it’s facing.

Infiltrator.description: Passes through the opposing Pokémon’s barrier, substitute, and the like and strikes.

Mummy.description: Contact with the Pokémon changes the attacker’s Ability to Mummy.

Moxie.description: The Pokémon shows moxie, and that boosts the Attack stat after knocking out any Pokémon.

Justified.description: Being hit by a Dark-type move boosts the Attack stat of the Pokémon, for justice.

Rattled.description: Dark-, Ghost-, and Bug-type moves scare the Pokémon and boost its Speed stat.

Magic Bounce.description: Reflects status moves, instead of getting hit by them.

Sap Sipper.description: Boosts the Attack stat if hit by a Grass-type move, instead of taking damage.

Prankster.description: Gives priority to a status move.

Sand Force.description: Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.

Iron Barbs.description: Inflicts damage to the attacker on contact with iron barbs.

Zen Mode.description: Changes the Pokémon’s shape when HP is half or less.

Victory Star.description: Boosts the accuracy of its allies and itself.

Turboblaze.description: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

Teravolt.description: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

Aroma Veil.description: Protects itself and its allies from attacks that limit their move choices.

Flower Veil.description: Ally Grass-type Pokémon are protected from status conditions and the lowering of their stats.

Cheek Pouch.description: Restores HP as well when the Pokémon eats a Berry.

Protean.description: Changes the Pokémon’s type to the type of the move it’s about to use.

Fur Coat.description: Halves the damage from physical moves.

Magician.description: The Pokémon steals the held item of a Pokémon it hits with a move.

Bulletproof.description: Protects the Pokémon from some ball and bomb moves.

Competitive.description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat sharply when a stat is lowered.

Strong Jaw.description: The Pokémon’s strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

Refrigerate.description: Normal-type moves become Ice-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

Sweet Veil.description: Prevents itself and ally Pokémon from falling asleep.

Stance Change.description: The Pokémon changes its form to Blade Forme when it uses an attack move, and changes to Shield Forme when it uses King’s Shield.

Gale Wings.description: Gives priority to Flying-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is full.

Mega Launcher.description: Powers up aura and pulse moves.

Grass Pelt.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat in Grassy Terrain.

Symbiosis.description: The Pokémon passes its item to an ally that has used up an item.

Tough Claws.description: Powers up moves that make direct contact.

Pixilate.description: Normal-type moves become Fairy-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

Gooey.description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker’s Speed stat.

Aerilate.description: Normal-type moves become Flying-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

Dark Aura.description: Powers up each Pokémon’s Dark-type moves.

Fairy Aura.description: Powers up each Pokémon’s Fairy-type moves.

Aura Break.description: The effects of “Aura” Abilities are reversed to lower the power of affected moves.

Primordial Sea.description: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Fire-type attacks.

Desolate Land.description: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Water-type attacks.

Delta Stream.description: The Pokémon changes the weather to eliminate all of the Flying type’s weaknesses.

Stamina.description: Boosts the Defense stat when hit by an attack.

Wimp Out.description: The Pokémon cowardly switches out when its HP becomes half or less.

Emergency Exit.description: The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP becomes half or less.

Water Compaction.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat sharply when hit by a Water-type move.

Merciless.description: The Pokémon’s attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned.

Shields Down.description: When its HP becomes half or less, the Pokémon’s shell breaks and it becomes aggressive.

Stakeout.description: Doubles the damage dealt to the target’s replacement if the target switches out.

Water Bubble.description: Lowers the power of Fire-type moves done to the Pokémon and prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

Berserk.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Sp. Atk stat when it takes a hit that causes its HP to become half or less.

Slush Rush.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in a hailstorm.

Long Reach.description: The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.

Liquid Voice.description: All sound-based moves become Water-type moves.

Triage.description: Gives priority to a healing move.

Galvanize.description: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

Surge Surfer.description: Doubles the Pokémon’s Speed stat on Electric Terrain.

Schooling.description: When it has a lot of HP, the Pokémon forms a powerful school. It stops schooling when its HP is low.

Disguise.description: Once per battle, the shroud that covers the Pokémon can protect it from an attack.

Battle Bond.description: Defeating an opposing Pokémon strengthens the Pokémon’s bond with its Trainer, and it becomes Ash-Greninja. Water Shuriken gets more powerful.

Power Construct.description: Other Cells gather to aid when its HP becomes half or less. Then the Pokémon changes its form to Complete Forme.

Corrosion.description: The Pokémon can poison the target even if it’s a Steel or Poison type.

Comatose.description: It’s always drowsing and will never wake up. It can attack without waking up.

Queenly Majesty.description: Its majesty pressures the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.

Innards Out.description: Damages the attacker landing the finishing hit by the amount equal to its last HP.

Dancer.description: When another Pokémon uses a dance move, it can use a dance move following it regardless of its Speed.

Battery.description: Powers up ally Pokémon’s special moves.

Fluffy.description: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.

Dazzling.description: Surprises the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.

Soul-Heart.description: Boosts its Sp. Atk stat every time a Pokémon faints.

Tangling Hair.description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker’s Speed stat.

Receiver.description: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

Power of Alchemy.description: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

Beast Boost.description: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

RKS System.description: Changes the Pokémon’s type to match the memory disc it holds.

Electric Surge.description: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Psychic Surge.description: Turns the ground into Psychic Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Misty Surge.description: Turns the ground into Misty Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Grassy Surge.description: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Full Metal Body.description: Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon’s stats.

Shadow Shield.description: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.

Prism Armor.description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
